page.title: 19M25 TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: M25 TRAFFIC SURVEY On Friday 17th May 1985 some children from Capel Manor School did a traffic survey on the M.(Motorway) 25. First we did the west going traffic. There were 345 cars, 133 lorries, 36 vans, 2 motorbikes, 5 coaches and 6 caravans. Then we went on to the east going traffic. There were 410 cars, 146 lorries, 48 vans, 2 motorbikes, 4 coaches and 1 caravan. We found out that there was more traffic going east than west. We think it is because the M25 ends ' miles later if you go west. The M25 will be finished in 1986. We did this for half an hour from 9.52am to 10.am, 15 minutes on each side.
